text: Aspergillus implicatus is a species of fungus in the genus Aspergillus. It is from the Sparsi section. The species was first described in 1994.Maggi, O.; Persiani, A.M. 1994. Aspergillus implicatus, a new species isolated from Ivory Coast forest soil. Mycological Research. 98:869-873 It has been reported to produce a versicolorin derivative. ==Growth and morphology== A. implicatus has been cultivated on both Czapek yeast extract agar (CYA) plates and Malt Extract Agar Oxoid® (MEAOX) plates. The growth morphology of the colonies can be seen in the pictures below. Aspergillus_implicatus_cya.png|Aspergillus implicatus growing on CYA plate Aspergillus_implicatus_meaox.png|Aspergillus implicatus growing on MEAOX plate == References == implicatus Category:Fungi described in 1994
title: Aspergillus implicatus
